thread.title: Traffic congestion costs SA over R1bn - Joburg mayor
thread.title_full: Traffic congestion costs SA over R1bn - Joburg mayor | News24

author: news24.com
title: Traffic congestion costs SA over R1bn - Joburg mayor
text:
Johannesburg - New forms of mobility are needed to ensure the escalating cost of traffic congestion is brought to a halt, Johannesburg Mayor Parks Tau said on Thursday.
"As it stands, the economic impact that results from congestion in the whole of South Africa is over R1bn, and Johannesburg accounts for the highest loss with more than 1.5 million vehicles registered across the metropolitan," he said in a speech prepared for delivery.
"As the city's economic hub and Africa's richest square mile, Sandton is under threat of becoming a giant parking lot and subsequently collapsing our economic well being."
Speaking at the launch of the EcoMobility World Festival and Transport Month in Sandton, Tau said a number of roads in the city's northern economic hub had been closed off to private vehicles for October.
